greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle of Bessel numbers read by rows. Row n gives T(n,n), T(n,n-1), T(n,n-2), ..., T(n,1) for n >= 1.
comment: T(n,k) = number of partitions of an n-set into k nonempty subsets, each of size at most 2.
reference: J. Y. Choi and J. D. H. Smith, On the unimodality and combinatorics of Bessel numbers, Discrete Math., 264 (2003), 45-53.
formula: The Choi-Smith reference gives many further properties and formulas.
xref: A100861 is another version of this triangle. Row sums give A000085.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 25 2005
ext: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 09 2005
